page.title: 13Housing
page.content: Most of the housing is Victorian or earlier. Many of the houses have had money spent on them in recent years & the area has a prosperous look with some properties attractive enough to be on a rural calendar. Some houses are of cob & thatch, others of local stone with a slate roof. At the side of the railway track are 2 semi- detached brick houses out of character with the rest of the area, these were formerly used by railway employees. Chandlers Hall, the local house of distinction, has now been skillfully divided into several accomodations. On the road between Colyton and Honiton there is a very isolated, attractive modern house. This house is part of a riding school complex. Another isolated house with a good deal of land attached is used as a boarding kennel.
